alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 7:08PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Gallatin County through 745 PM MDT... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Yellowstone, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Yellowstone, Yellowstone Village and Targhee Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
